title: The February 2025 EVE Online Monthly Economic Report
description: As I noted last month, I am cutting back on what I post about the MER.  All those tables, while generated for me in PowerBI, do take a bit of work to get over into WordPress… it is a manual export to .csv then applying some formatting rules to the columns to get them setup… […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: As I noted last month, I am cutting back on what I post about the MER. All those tables, while generated for me in PowerBI, do take a bit of work to get over into WordPress… it is a manual e…
text: As I noted last month, I am cutting back on what I post about the MER.  All those tables, while generated for me in PowerBI, do take a bit of work to get over into WordPress… it is a manual export to .csv then applying some formatting rules to the columns to get them setup… and didn’t seem all that interesting to anybody besides me, so I will be posting a subset of that and maybe a chart or two about things besides destruction. EVE Online nerds harder I also promoted the EVE Monthly Economic Report tag to a category, so you can now find it in the drop down on the side bar if you’re just dying to have some MER porn on demand. As always, others write a lot about the MER, so if you are interested there are sources worth seeking. CCP – February 2025 Monthly Economic Report CCP – February 2025 MER Forum Thread Reddit – February 2025 MER Thread TNG – February 2025 Activity In EVE Online TNG – A Look At The February 2025 Active ISK Delta YouTube – February 2025 MER Analysis with CSM Oz (coming?) CCP Highlights CCP has taken to calling out a few items from the MER every month, so I figure I should report on what they think is important.  For February the had: Production Value has seen a significant increase (11.2%) in February. Mining Value has been steady during the Febuary Period, after 3 months of strong growth. Bounties has seen a 16% increase over February, while the commodity ISK faucet has been steady. The MPI has been steady! I like the mineral price index item, because last month it hit an all time high… so it  was a reason to celebrate in that didn’t get any worse than it was already.  A plateau has been reached. February 2025 – Economic Indices since 2018 CCP has acknowledged there is a problem… which is a rare enough moment for them as it is… saying that the Equinox debacle made mining so much less attractive to null sec that players moved to ratting for income.  Null sec mining was already a chore, with taxes and rules and the usual hunters out looking for an easy mining barge kill, so it turned out that trade off where the sovereignty owner could pick the ore they wanted only to be rewarded with tiny rocks and sparse spawns was not the rejuvenation CCP thought it was going to be.  We’ll see if the proposed solution, which is a level 3 mining upgrade that will eat up even more of the limited power and resource budget that Equinox imposed on sov null sec will help. 2025 Destruction Summary I am going to both simplify and expand this section to keep tracking the current year.  This covers all ships, pods, structures, and other things CCP reported destroyed in New Eden in 2025: Loss Count Total January – 514,511 total losses February – 427,027 total losses Avg Losses per Day January – 16,597.13 losses per day February – 15,250.96 losses per day ISK Value January – 46.86 trillion ISK February – 44.55 trillion ISK ISK Value per Day January – 1,511.77 billion ISK per day February – 1,590.99 billion ISK per day Uitra Watch With a total of 36,495 recorded losses in February, Uitra remained the system with the most losses for the month in all of New Eden yet again, accounting for a bit more than 8.5% of the losses recorded, more than double that of the next system, Jouvulen, another career agent system, which recorded 13,391 losses. Jita, which was traditionally the top system for losses barring any major event, up until the AIR Career Program skill point farming fad took over the game, recorded a mere 6,927 losses, putting it in fourth place. The losses for Uitra by ship class were as follows: Class  Count  Sum of ISK Lost Shuttle        18,364 391.64 million Corvette        17,658 2016.65 million Capsule              218 2.68 million Frigate              145 62.75 million Hauler                94 86.54 million Combat Battlecruiser                  7 390.00 million Destroyer                  6 42.55 million Attack Battlecruiser                  1 63.63 million Battleship                  1 200.68 million Cruiser                  1 9.79 million The 2025 tally for Uitra so far: January Total – 42,984 Shuttles – 28,675 Corvettes – 13,828 February Total – 36,495 Shuttles – 18,364 Corvettes – 17,658 Shuttle and Corvette Systems And just to keep track of the places where the AIR Career Program skill point farming is also happening, here are the top ten systems for the ship classes used most. Shuttles: Class  Count  Sum of ISK Lost System Region Shuttle        18,364 .39 billion Uitra The Forge Shuttle           9,356 .20 billion Jouvulen Lonetrek Shuttle           2,550 .05 billion Trossere Sinq Laison Shuttle           2,281 .04 billion Conoban Kor-Azor Shuttle           2,056 .04 billion Akiainavas Lonetrek Shuttle           1,803 3.89 billion Ahbazon Genesis Shuttle           1,473 22.38 billion Jita The Forge Shuttle           1,068 .02 billion Malukker Heimatar Shuttle           1,004 .02 billion Couster Essence Shuttle              871 .01 billion Clellinon Verge Vendor Any system in that top ten with less than a billion ISK in value lost is a farming system. Corvettes: Class  Count  Sum of ISK Lost System Region Corvette        17,658 2016.65 million Uitra The Forge Corvette           3,948 429.10 million Jouvulen Lonetrek Corvette           2,115 231.82 million Malukker Heimatar Corvette              998 22775.82 million Jita The Forge Corvette              882 1662.03 million Ahbazon Genesis Corvette              575 65.40 million Arzieh Khanid Corvette              406 46.18 million Conoban Kor-Azor Corvette              266 630.93 million Tama The Citadel Corvette              254 68.83 million Nisuwa Black Rise Corvette              150 415.08 million Kinakka Black Rise Corvettes are less obvious… and less used in some systems.  But the top three systems on that list are farming systems.
html:
As I noted last month, I am cutting back on what I post about the MER.  All those tables, while generated for me in PowerBI, do take a bit of work to get over into WordPress… it is a manual export to .csv then applying some formatting rules to the columns to get them setup… and didn’t seem all that interesting to anybody besides me, so I will be posting a subset of that and maybe a chart or two about things besides destruction.

EVE Online nerds harder

I also promoted the EVE Monthly Economic Report tag to a category, so you can now find it in the drop down on the side bar if you’re just dying to have some MER porn on demand.

As always, others write a lot about the MER, so if you are interested there are sources worth seeking.

  • CCP – February 2025 Monthly Economic Report
  • CCP – February 2025 MER Forum Thread
  • Reddit – February 2025 MER Thread
  • TNG – February 2025 Activity In EVE Online
  • TNG – A Look At The February 2025 Active ISK Delta
  • YouTube – February 2025 MER Analysis with CSM Oz (coming?)

CCP Highlights

CCP has taken to calling out a few items from the MER every month, so I figure I should report on what they think is important.  For February the had:

  • Production Value has seen a significant increase (11.2%) in February.
  • Mining Value has been steady during the Febuary Period, after 3 months of strong growth.
  • Bounties has seen a 16% increase over February, while the commodity ISK faucet has been steady.
  • The MPI has been steady!

I like the mineral price index item, because last month it hit an all time high… so it  was a reason to celebrate in that didn’t get any worse than it was already.  A plateau has been reached.

February 2025 – Economic Indices since 2018

CCP has acknowledged there is a problem… which is a rare enough moment for them as it is… saying that the Equinox debacle made mining so much less attractive to null sec that players moved to ratting for income.  Null sec mining was already a chore, with taxes and rules and the usual hunters out looking for an easy mining barge kill, so it turned out that trade off where the sovereignty owner could pick the ore they wanted only to be rewarded with tiny rocks and sparse spawns was not the rejuvenation CCP thought it was going to be.  We’ll see if the proposed solution, which is a level 3 mining upgrade that will eat up even more of the limited power and resource budget that Equinox imposed on sov null sec will help.

2025 Destruction Summary

I am going to both simplify and expand this section to keep tracking the current year.  This covers all ships, pods, structures, and other things CCP reported destroyed in New Eden in 2025:

  • Loss Count Total
    • January – 514,511 total losses
    • February – 427,027 total losses
  • Avg Losses per Day
    • January – 16,597.13 losses per day
    • February – 15,250.96 losses per day
  • ISK Value
    • January – 46.86 trillion ISK
    • February – 44.55 trillion ISK
  • ISK Value per Day
    • January – 1,511.77 billion ISK per day
    • February – 1,590.99 billion ISK per day

Uitra Watch

With a total of 36,495 recorded losses in February, Uitra remained the system with the most losses for the month in all of New Eden yet again, accounting for a bit more than 8.5% of the losses recorded, more than double that of the next system, Jouvulen, another career agent system, which recorded 13,391 losses.

Jita, which was traditionally the top system for losses barring any major event, up until the AIR Career Program skill point farming fad took over the game, recorded a mere 6,927 losses, putting it in fourth place.

The losses for Uitra by ship class were as follows:

Class  Count  Sum of ISK Lost
Shuttle        18,364 391.64 million
Corvette        17,658 2016.65 million
Capsule              218 2.68 million
Frigate              145 62.75 million
Hauler                94 86.54 million
Combat Battlecruiser                  7 390.00 million
Destroyer                  6 42.55 million
Attack Battlecruiser                  1 63.63 million
Battleship                  1 200.68 million
Cruiser                  1 9.79 million

The 2025 tally for Uitra so far:

  • January
    • Total – 42,984
    • Shuttles – 28,675
    • Corvettes – 13,828
  • February
    • Total – 36,495
    • Shuttles – 18,364
    • Corvettes – 17,658

Shuttle and Corvette Systems

And just to keep track of the places where the AIR Career Program skill point farming is also happening, here are the top ten systems for the ship classes used most.

Shuttles:

Class  Count  Sum of ISK Lost System Region
Shuttle        18,364 .39 billion Uitra The Forge
Shuttle           9,356 .20 billion Jouvulen Lonetrek
Shuttle           2,550 .05 billion Trossere Sinq Laison
Shuttle           2,281 .04 billion Conoban Kor-Azor
Shuttle           2,056 .04 billion Akiainavas Lonetrek
Shuttle           1,803 3.89 billion Ahbazon Genesis
Shuttle           1,473 22.38 billion Jita The Forge
Shuttle           1,068 .02 billion Malukker Heimatar
Shuttle           1,004 .02 billion Couster Essence
Shuttle              871 .01 billion Clellinon Verge Vendor

Any system in that top ten with less than a billion ISK in value lost is a farming system.

Corvettes:

Class  Count  Sum of ISK Lost System Region
Corvette        17,658 2016.65 million Uitra The Forge
Corvette           3,948 429.10 million Jouvulen Lonetrek
Corvette           2,115 231.82 million Malukker Heimatar
Corvette              998 22775.82 million Jita The Forge
Corvette              882 1662.03 million Ahbazon Genesis
Corvette              575 65.40 million Arzieh Khanid
Corvette              406 46.18 million Conoban Kor-Azor
Corvette              266 630.93 million Tama The Citadel
Corvette              254 68.83 million Nisuwa Black Rise
Corvette              150 415.08 million Kinakka Black Rise

Corvettes are less obvious… and less used in some systems.  But the top three systems on that list are farming systems.
